item.title: ‚ú® The new Neuropixels 1.0-NHP extends this technology for use in larger animal brains, like those of macaques, by using longer probes ‚Äì 25 and 45 millimeters long -- that can access deep structures in larger brains. (4/8)

item.content:encoded: ‚ú® The new Neuropixels 1.0-NHP extends this technology for use in larger animal brains, like those of macaques, by using longer probes ‚Äì 25 and 45 millimeters long -- that can access deep structures in larger brains. (4/8)

item.title: ü•º The new probes fill a niche, where up until now, researchers studying large animals used large, invasive probes to record neural activity from dozens of neurons. Neuropixels 1.0-NHP are much smaller & less invasive, and can record from hundreds of neurons simultaneously. (5/8)

item.title: üñ•Ô∏è By allowing researchers to record the activity from hundreds of individual neurons in a single session, it will be possible to study brain function in large animals in greater detail and reduce the time needed for experiments. (6/8)

item.title:
